body:
Currently, `spack checksum ...` does not store the downloads in the spack cache.

### Rationale

This leads to duplicate downloads of packages.

### Description

A scenario. 

I was looking to add some new versions for a package, so I ran `spack checksum ...` to generate that list. That worked great, but the packages that were downloaded were NOT then added to the cache, so when I later ran `spack mirror create ...` I had to redownload everything... 

Not a huge deal, but it would be a nice improvement to have the checksum'd files in the cache and have the mirror creation use those downloaded, cached files.
title: `spack checkusm` doesn't use the cache
